intro: Echinospermum lappula var. longifolium, commonly known as the longleaf lappula, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops. The plant features slender, branching stems with alternate, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces distinctive, hairy fruits called silicles. This variant is characterized by its elongated leaves, distinguishing it from other varieties within the species.
